alert.note: Alert for Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 14 at 3:02AM EST until February 14 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Columbia affecting Lexington and Richland Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Congaree River At Columbia. * WHEN...From early this morning to late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding occurs in flood prone areas near and downstream from Columbia. Flooding also occurs on parts of the Cayce and West Columbia river walk. At 13.0 feet, Flooding occurs in flood prone areas near and downstream from Columbia. Flooding also occurs over much of the Cayce and West Columbia river walk. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.2 feet later this morning. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 300 PM EST.
